English.Text: The fruit-pickers don't believe you are who you threaten to be, and if anything, your surly attitude makes them wonder if it could be you the Queen is running away from. They call out to the rest of the pickers, who stand shoulder-to-shoulder with them in case you should think of taking things any further. Turning miserably back to your carriage in the road, it is only after considerable soul-searching that you re-read Sir Archibald's briefing, "despite her secrecy, a Queen never travels humbly." Of course, how stupid! One of the countless castles that dominate the hills all around. It is now but a question of exactly which of her landed relatives she came here to visit...
